alert.note: Alert for Houston; Inland Harris; Madison; Montgomery; Northern Liberty; Polk; San Jacinto; Trinity; Walker; Waller (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:14AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A line of thunderstorms will produce strong wind gusts across portions of southwestern Trinity, northwestern Fort Bend, Montgomery, San Jacinto, southwestern Houston, northeastern Madison, northwestern Liberty, southeastern Waller, southwestern Polk, Walker and northwestern Harris Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 213 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Austonio to 10 miles west of Trinity to Huntsville State Park to near Lake Conroe Dam to near Katy. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Conroe, Huntsville, Bellaire, Humble, West University Place, Katy, Tomball, Cleveland, Jersey Village, Crockett, Willis, Brookshire, Hunters Creek Village, Bunker Hill Village, Piney Point Village, Pinehurst, Greenway / Upper Kirby Area, Spring Branch North, The Woodlands and Greater Greenspoint. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for southeastern Texas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for southeastern Texas.

area.areaDesc: Houston; Inland Harris; Madison; Montgomery; Northern Liberty; Polk; San Jacinto; Trinity; Walker; Waller
